sustainable energy.Description: Solar power is a form of sustainable energy that harnesses the power of the sun to generate electricity.
Wind power is a form of sustainable energy that converts the kinetic energy of wind into electricity.
Hydropower is a form of sustainable energy that uses the force of flowing or falling water to generate electricity.
Geothermal energy is a form of sustainable energy that utilizes heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity or heat buildings.
Biomass energy is a form of sustainable energy that derives from organic materials, such as wood, crops, or waste, and can be used for heating or electricity generation.
Tidal power is a form of sustainable energy that harnesses the energy from the rise and fall of tides to generate electricity.
Nuclear power is a form of low-carbon energy that generates electricity through nuclear reactions, providing a sustainable alternative to fossil fuels.
Sustainable energy involves the practice of energy efficiency, which aims to reduce energy consumption and waste by using technology and design strategies.
Sustainable energy relies on the implementation of a smart grid, which enables efficient distribution and management of electricity from renewable sources.
Sustainable energy promotes the use of electric vehicles, which reduce greenhouse gas emissions and dependence on fossil fuels in transportation.
